data.title: Probably better in the day....
data.text:
Really cool little place, great music, funky brothers, fantastic menu, food fell flat. Gypee portions 
 Very mediocre to poor omelet 
Amazing chocolate cake. 
Wow

data.title: the best
data.text: we tried almost the whole menu its all v.goooood we love this place ..good food and good service .. its become our favourait 😍😍😍😍😍

data.title: Great find
data.text: We were looking for a breakfast place near our hotel.  I found this on tripadvisor and we thought we'd try it. There was no parking out front but plenty of municipal parking around the corner.  We walked in and were seated immediately.   My son got milk in a cute glass.  I got coffee and water.  The water was in a pitcher with lemon and mint.  Very refreshing.  My son got the pancakes and sausage and loved it. I had an eggwhite omelette and it was excellent.   I would go back if I'm in the area

data.title: Great comfort food - Don't miss out on Leo's Diner
data.text: I've been wanting to try Leo's Diner for awhile.    If you haven't tried it yet - you won't be disappointed.    Great diner menu - I enjoyed a chicken kabob with Greek salad.    The cook takes great pride in his presentation and service.    Great value.

data.title: A Hidden Gem - great food, great atmosphere
data.text:
Leo's is a great place for breakfast!  Warm, welcoming diner-style ambiance with fun music memorabilia on the walls.  Raffi (the manager) has a smile and excellent service for every patron.

The menu offers a wonderful blend of breakfast classics - eggs, pancakes, home fries and breads, and some creative omelettes.  The omelettes are lovingly prepared, feature fresh ingredients, and nothing too oily.  The home fries are tasty without being greasy.  In fact, the entire menu is well-crafted and much less greasy than traditional diner preparations.  Good coffee - even the decaf.

I've been back to the place several times since discovering it a few months ago, and brought many friends here, too.  Every one of them has thanked me for introducing them to this delightful breakfast/brunch spot. 

Special note:  A little hard to find because the sign is not on the awning or on top of the entrance.  Look for the street number.  It's worth finding this place.

data.title: Breakfast, anyone?
data.text: If you're like me, you like to get up on a Saturday or Sunday morning, have a cup or three of your favorite coffee, and then head out for breakfast. When I do that these days, my favorite local spot in a city known for a variety of appealing dining places in one that is still fairly new - Leo's Diner, right across Main St. from the Waltham, City Hall. Their breakfast menu is overflowing with choices in all three breakfast food categories:  1. Eggs, served as you like 'em'' 2. Pancakes, plan and simple of with belly busting topping and 3. other fare, including the old breakfast standbys, oatmeal and fruit.  Whatever you choose, it will be served up with a big helping of the Blues, not live, but still...   Hint: Go early to avoid waiting.
